website_summaries.verdict: May be on the larger side but that’s a minor tradeoff for sturdy steel construction, easy pump-up of high pressure bike tires and a reliable seal. Don’t use it on expensive hardwood floors, though.
pros: Long air hose pivots 360 degrees at the barrel base, making it easier to reach awkwardly placed valves
Accurate gauge and popular dual-nozzle head with Presta and Schrader valves built in
Sport ball and bladder adapters included, and snugly fit in a clip attached to the hose
cons: Steel base doesn’t sit flat and can rock back and forth during use
Base’s rough steel edge can scratch floors
Nozzle’s toggle switch to be too stiff
Some couldn’t get a good seal to their Presta valves
Large size can be difficult to store

customer_reviews.title: Great for an upper arm workout, not great for a bike pump.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, terrible, bad awful day. I bought this over a year ago and didn't have the need to use it until now. My bike tires were flat. First, it did not come with instructions. Secondly, when I googled how to use it I found there were a lot of complaints. I was able to start pumping air into my tires but my 66 year-old arms were worn out when I finished. Presta valve leaks. I guess maybe "just a few pumps" works for a he-man but I was pushing really hard to inflate. Mind you, I'm a nurse who works and moves very heavy patients and equipment around so I'm not frail. Still .. I can't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoran Woman

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why so many negative reviews. This is the second Topeak Joe Blow I've owned and it works really well. You just have to know the proper way to use it. Gotta make sure the pump head is properly attached/seated to the valve stem before beginning. Lock it in place correctly, then start pumping. Granted, it takes a few extra pumps to fill the tire due to the small diameter of the tube. But other than that, this thing works great!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Glue on the little cap on the bottom the day you get this pump
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, they put a little cap at the bottom of the pump which, when lost, renders the pump totally useless. I never even got to use the pump once before losing the cap which worked itself off at some point. So be sure to glue or tape that cap on on asap. Of course, the cap is not available for sale on the manufactures web site. So I have to decide if I want to spend the $50 on a second pump and keep the other other one for spare parts or but a pump from another brand that knows how to make a reliable pump.
customer_reviews.author: D. Parquette

customer_reviews.title: Like a Timex after hiccup
customer_reviews.text: Avid Rider... 5 of 6 days a week, good milage and an arsenal of bikes for all occasions. This pump has been with me for years. About 3 months into using it the "end" started acting up... I contacted the company and they sent me a new head. When I received the head my old one started working again properly and has been going for years, with Stan's and the abuse it takes I'm very surprised. Can't say much more except I dinged it for the first issue.... But for $35.... Come on.
customer_reviews.author: Stay at Home Dad

customer_reviews.title: subpar pump all around
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that this pump can support both types of valves, but it doesn't actually work all that well. I found it super difficult to get it to attach to the valve, so it ends up taking me several minutes to get a seal on each tire in order to pump it. Once it's attached the pump seems to work well. My old pump (Serfas branded) that also works for both types of valves was much easier to attach. Overall, this will work in a pinch, but would NOT recommend for regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: This thing blows, and not in a good way
customer_reviews.text: It looks well built. However, trying to seat the end on the valve stem is next to impossible. Maybe I got a bad one, but all it did was let out what little air was in the tire. I never could get it seated, let alone locked. Returned. BTW, Amazon did a really poor job of packaging this. Put it in an oversized box, very poorly sealed, with next to no packing material around it. And then they shipped it via UPS, who managed to put no less than 4 good sized holes in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas SteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to bike tires
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to inflate the tires on my hybrid bike prior to riding. It works great for this purpose and I can inflate the tires really quickly. The gauge is accurate and the product seems to be made of high quality. I’m confident it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jlrrx2206

customer_reviews.title: the base is metal and that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: pumping up my tires is a breeze......the base is metal and that's a good thing....there are plastic components all around but doe not feel flimsy in any way.....the gauge has a yellow marker so you know when your a few pumps away from the right tire pressure. There are several moderately priced floor pumps on the market that rival/equal or perhaps tad superior...but I have no regrets at all...replaceable parts are perhaps more available with this model than some other brands out there which is another plus. I have presta valves and have no issues with the connectivity with very little loss of air.
customer_reviews.author: brazzhead

customer_reviews.title: I was pumped about this product - :)
customer_reviews.text: Great pump, but for the size and stroke of it there isn't too much air making it to the tire. My old pump was smaller but sure moved a lot more air per stroke. Also, the stem locking mechanism is plastic (as are most) but feels like it will snap off each time you lock it onto something. Not sure how long the lock will last, but do like the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Geo Von Finklestein

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the last one - So Far!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Topeak Floor Pump, so far the only issue I see is the re-designed bezel does not hold the pressure guide as well as the old one. Other that that very happy with this pump.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Scott

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Powerful enough to Inflate Car Tires
customer_reviews.text: This is solid and quality built floor pump. My air pumping experience has been great for both Presta and Schrader valves for road and mountain bike. The lever and the nozzle is tough so it doesn't look like it will wear out easily like those hand pumps. I was able to inflate my car tires no problem. It worked like charm... I no longer need to go to gas station and pay for air my tires... get this floor pump and pump away..
customer_reviews.author: cheez

customer_reviews.title: ) It is the best bicycle pump I have
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a while; finally got around to using it. (Summer, I spend on the water, now it's cooler.) It is the best bicycle pump I have. Points: Base is stable. Pump doesn't wobble even when I'm not standing on it. Stroke is smooth and even. Gauge is easy to read, the needle settles quickly, and there is an indicator to make it easier to see when you have reached the desired pressure. The dual head is incredibly easy to use. It locks on quickly, doesn't leak, and you don't have to change anything to switch between Presta and Shrader valves. I highly recommend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Publius

customer_reviews.title: First rate pump, can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: You really can't go wrong with this pump. I've got an older one that's still going strong after a decade of heavy use including pumping up a lot of race tires to 150psi. This is my 2nd one that I got for the convenience of having one at another spot and it's even better. Love how they added the pressure release so you don't need to worry about getting it off quickly. All around fantastic pump.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherJ

customer_reviews.title: Nuisances, but otherwise good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality floor pump. Solid. The built in pressure gauge is a plus, you can get the pressure exactly where you want. It's not five stars because: I wish the base were wider or had a kick-down foot pedal to hold it steady. It's unstable if you're pumping quickly. The double-headed valve connector. It's kinda big and hard to wedge into spaces like stroller tires, the locking lever is stiff and has to be moved opposite the direction of installation on the tire valve. Cumbersome and frustrating if you've got a really flat tube you're trying to hold in place. Despite the nuisances, it's a good quality pump.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: The valve is garbage, quit working after 2 yrs
customer_reviews.text: Can't get a good seal on my presta valves anymore. When I put it on the valve I can't even push down on it. Have to borrow a pump nearly every time I ride. Shoulda gone with the Specialized pump with the good valve. This one has a cheap plastic valve on it.
customer_reviews.author: RunMore

customer_reviews.title: Scharader / Presta who cares it works on it!
customer_reviews.text: How could it be bad. The wife has a schrader valve on her bike and I have a presta valve. Just flip the nozzle over and it works great on both. The attached pressure gauge works great. Nice sturdy construction and feels like it will last the test of time. The nephews came over the other day and we used the attached needle to pump up the basketball. Not small (not that you would want a tiny pump) but easy to throw into the car for a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Cassique

customer_reviews.title: Good: - Looks great - Gauge on dial to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good: - Looks great - Gauge on dial to show when it reaches the expected pressure works well - Grip is pretty comfortable Bad: - Didn't work great with Presta valves (the skinny kind usually on road bikes). Pressure guage would show absurd values, you'd have to put a few pumps in before something would click inside it and move something and then you'd get the right pressure reading. This was particularly annoying because I bought the dual head in the hopes of avoiding any annoying issues like that. - Base is metal, and looked sharp, with no rubber on it to protect the floor below it. I worried that this pump would leave marks in my wood floor.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gayther

customer_reviews.title: Great pump.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great pump. I love it. Easy to use. The only thing I didn't care for was the fact that the hose was short. I mean, when I have my bike in the stand, the hose is almost too short to get to the valve stem. However, I replaced it with a longer one and thus I'm happy with it. If you don't do your own wrenching and just need a pump, this will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: The dual head is difficult to fit
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two of these pumps and they were great. The head design was changed so that now it has a side dual presta/schroeder on the same axis. It is difficult to fit the valve because it is so wide if the wheel spokes are close together. Also, the needle was not included.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Gal

customer_reviews.title: Can be tough to get to seal on Presta valves
customer_reviews.text: This pump is solidly built and has a clear and easy to read pressure gage. However, I have trouble getting it to seal properly on Presta valves. I find that sometimes it takes 2 or 3 tries to get it to seal and even then it sometimes leaks a bit requiring me to pump as quickly as I can to push more in than is leaking out. I've had no issue getting it to seal to Schraeder valves. Given we have bikes with both times of valves in the family, the dual port design was a feature I wanted. I believe if I only had Presta valves, I'd go with a different product.
customer_reviews.author: jwrogers80

customer_reviews.title: Great pump! I saved at least $20 plus tax ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pump! I saved at least $20 plus tax from the bike shop for the exact same pump. Very easy to use. Attach to valve with it in the straight position then turn lever away from valve to get it to attach then start pumping away. Also comes with a ball needle and cone object to inflate pool type toys etc - haven't used those attachments yet. Little effort needed to get the tires pumped. Easy to read gauge. Entire thing is steel - handles are rubber coated. A lot of the other floor pumps you see are mostly plastic components
customer_reviews.author: NMB

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Super exceeded all my expectations! I really like the two way head and when you release from the valve stem it bleed off air so it make disengaging from the tire simple and quick with no loss of air in the tire.
customer_reviews.author: c. shaw

customer_reviews.title: Almost great, but not really
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this product is getting good reviews both here on Amazon and other websites like Outdoor Gear Lab for example:  I agree that it's a solid product all around, and I love that it pumps easily at 100+psi, but I found the chuck incredibly finicky, and difficult to get a good seal on Presta valves. I returned it for a Serfas FP-200 and all is well. The Serfas doesn't pump so nicely at 100+psi, but at least I don't have to mess with the chuck. Topeak, re-engineer your chuck and you're money!
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: Every bicycling household needs a floor pump. There are better ones out there, and there are cheaper ones out there. But I have not fount a better floor pump cheaper. The Joe Blow Sport does its job well, the metal valve head works well and appears durable, and the built in pressure gauge is accurate. This pump replaced a Schwinn floor pump that must be rated as do not buy. It began to fail within a month and was unusable after 3 months. Joe Blow has been in faithful service now starting his second season. Works like new. A good sign. We'll see if it is still working in 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: PACoug

customer_reviews.title: Good but leaves something to be desired
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pump but it is hard to use. You need three hands to attach it. And it died after 4 years. I ordered a repair kit which at nearly $8 was expensive for two rubber seals and two new plastic caps which I did not need. No instructions came with the kit nor with the pump itself. The company web site was useless but I figured it out and after the second try it is working fine. When I was a kid I used a 10 year old pump and it worked better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: excellent pump!
customer_reviews.text: I tried some cheaper pumps before this one and had to put all my body weight onto them to get enough pressure into the tires of my road bike. This one still takes some effort towards the end but is easier by far. It also feels distinctly different, real versus a toy. The attachment that lets you blow up pool floats is also very handy with 3 kids. The last time I used it I did have a little problem worth mentioning though. It seemed like air was just leaking out of the pump even though it had a good seal. I finally realized I needed to tighten the little screw knob near the bottom. Who knew?
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: New Joe Blow pump leaks around its two way valve
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of the Joe Blow pumps. It replaced an older one which was almost always leaking air while pumping up my road bike tires (presta valve). The new one sealed wonderfully for the first 5 or so uses. Now it seems to be leaking through the valve back out of the opposing schraeder fitting. I am coping for now by over-pressuring the tires and then using a gauge to step down to my desired riding pressure. I expect that the multiway valve is leaking and would need to be replaced for the pump to operate as intended.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: and I like that it has a bicycle pump and tube attachment
customer_reviews.text: This does basically everything you could want it to, and I like that it has a bicycle pump and tube attachment. I was using a bicycle attached hand pump for my hybrid bicycle, then when I used this, realized that it was severely underinflated. I took it down the shore, and used it to pump up all the floats for our kids, last year blowing them up by hand took forever. The only thing it could use (which expensive topeak models have) is a pressure release valve if you put too much air in, but that's such an offbeat use case to me it wasn't worth paying extra for.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The dial is the only up side ....it really is a most pass up.
customer_reviews.text: I'm riposting this review on the Joe Blow Sport 2 Floor Pump. After one year I will tell you cyclist pass this pump up. Because it's not user friendly and came with no directions, does not make a tight seal on the presta valves on my bike. My small bike pump out performed better and faster. You have to have the right size valve for a good seal. Something Topeak failed to mention and should have included an adapter. Pass this pump up save your money because it blows.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing/design led to predictable failure.
customer_reviews.text: Pump pulled apart and the release mechanism was damaged and won't stay together. Also found that the lever required so much force to lock that two of my team riders pulled the tubeless stem right out of the rim.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: great! i've had this pump for 3 years now ...
customer_reviews.text: great! i've had this pump for 3 years now and it hasn't failed me yet. at one point my car's tire was leaking air. so i had to use this to pump it up. i must have did it a dozon or more times...of heavy pumping for like 30+ times. so i have put it to work...and it has held up to it! you won't need to pump that much for small volumes suchs as balls and bike wheels but with effort you can use it to pump up a flat car sedan tire. awesome!
customer_reviews.author: ric

customer_reviews.title: Best pump I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best pump I've owned, definitely worth the little extra money. This thing is built like a tank, totally solid and heavy (so probably not the most portable option) All the compatibility options you need and filling up my tires has never been this painless. Nice form factor, takes up a small footprint next to my wall rack.
customer_reviews.author: mshock

customer_reviews.title: versatile affordable high quality pump
customer_reviews.text: great high-quality Taiwanese-made floor pump instead of some of the crappy junk made in China. I love the head that lets you choose between high pressure presta or lower pressure schrader valves instead of a head I had on another pump that supposedly worked for both but was a real pain on presta valves. This is a replacement for an old faithful pump I have used for more than 12 years until it accidentally got left outside last winter. The pressure gauge is easier to read than the one on the original pump and the base seems to be somewhat heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Rathbun, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd one of these. I keep one at each house.
customer_reviews.author: LegalTech

customer_reviews.title: Simple, solid, great-working bike pump
customer_reviews.text: Love this pump! It's been 100% reliable for me, and the twin end caps is the simplest and easiest solution to the presta/shchraeder application I've seen yet. The locking lever works great, and both sides seal quickly and easily to the stem. Solid, weighty, high quality feel, sturdy hose, and includes attachments (needle for sports balls) and inflatables (a cone-shaped thingie). All told, highly recommended, I've had it for a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: BIKE4LIFE

customer_reviews.title: The head is made of plastic that breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the Topeak Joe Blow Sport II Floor Pump a year ago for my 8 year old son's bike. I pump his bike tires a couple times and his basket ball a couple times, but the twin head is already broken. It doesn't pressurize the air enough to pump the air into the tire anymore. I thought I have invested on the decent product so I can keep it for a long time. I should have gone to Walmart to pick up $10 pump that only handles schrader valve.
customer_reviews.author: HAG91

customer_reviews.title: One annoying flaw on an otherwise awesome pump.
customer_reviews.text: A great pump with one annoying flaw. The large base keeps it stable. The large handles give you a lot of leverage. And, I like the way the hose stores. Gauge is accurate and easy to see. The problem is when pumping up a presta bike tire the fitting inhibits the unseating of the presta valve. Usually end up wiggling the fitting or repositioning it several times before it will work right.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Now "this is a bike pump!"
customer_reviews.text: Five stars because its description is quite accurate. This pump is solid, made mostly of steel, and has a strong base to place your feet upon. Pumping strokes are short and smooth and fill the tire quickly. The hose is rubber and not too stiff. The valve connector is solid and easily connects to a Presta or Shrader valve. The air gage seems to be quite accurate and is quite readable - even for those over 40 years of age. Bottom line: This is a quality floor pump - buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Last Picasso

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: It works well, the gauge is easy to read and it pumps quickly.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kochan

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Feels sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the pump feels well made and should last. I use it to pump my road bike tires to 130 psi with ease. Gauge is easy to read. The barrel and the stand are metal as described. The handle is plastic, but doesn't feel flimsy or cheap. I feel it'll last as long as the rest of the pump. The lever on the double-sided twinhead is also metal I believe. The twinhead is plastic it appears. (It's replaceable if it breaks, but double check me on that.) The only issue (and it's minor) is that the twin head is large and hard to use on small tires..like my daughter's little starter bike.
customer_reviews.author: LiveSimply

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pump.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 2 years now. The duel head makes it very easy to use with presto or schrader valves - no having to take it apart to switch - just use one side or the other. Great pressure, pumps air fast. Comes with needle for inflating soccer balls, etc and a cone adaptor for inflating rafts/inner-tubes/mattresses. The gauge is easy to read while pumping. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: UTBadger

customer_reviews.title: Not the best pump in the world.
customer_reviews.text: Well, this LOOKED like a good pump, and it's not BAD, mind you, but it's not GREAT either. First of all, I wish SOMEONE could make a Presta valve pump the securely connects TO the valve...without leaking or "popping" off under pressure. This pump's Presta connector certainly does that. Second, it is NOT a high volume pump. Prepare for a workout if you're filling up MTB or other wide tires. You'll be pumping for a while. It works okay as a pump to throw in the car to top-off your tires, but as for a main pump I still just wind up using my little air compressor at home.
customer_reviews.author: 7cjbill2

customer_reviews.title: solid floor pump for the average person
customer_reviews.text: i'm not pumping up stuff all the time but this floor pump is sufficient to fill my cruiser, mountain bike or motorcycle tires when they're low, i've filled my neighbors presta valve tires without any trouble. the pressure gauge is easy to read, consistent and accurate.i like having the double sided nozzle so there's nothing to unscrew or flip around when transitioning from schrader to presta. also nice that the needle is grabbed and held in place by the same lock as a when filling tires, no need to unscrew or flip anything to fill your basketball.
customer_reviews.author: doctor goose

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid pump.
customer_reviews.text: Has held up well with use several times a week, indoors and outdoors for a few years now. The black plastic collar holding the piston in the yellow tube came loose once, and I took it in to a dealer for warranty repair. The guy showed me how it snaps on, but indicated had that not worked Topean would have been glad to replace it! Other than that the hose and valve are super sturdy, mostly metal construction feels well made and the gauge is easy to read even at night!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Good pump, unreliable connection to presta valves.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the presta side to connect like some of the others here. This was true with 2 pumps. After many attempts it might work but that's too frustrating. You want a good connection the first try. You'd like to connect it and see it register the pressure that's in the tire on 1st try. Otherwise the pump is good. I bought the presta to schrader adapters and that works fine. It adds a few seconds but that's not a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Larry P.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this pump.
customer_reviews.text: I had several problems with this pump. When using the Presta valve, air leaked out the Schrader side. It was also difficult to determine if the pump was correctly connected to either the Presta or Schrader valve. Then to top it off, it started leaking at the joint where the tube connected to the pump body. I bought a different brand after using it for one month.
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: handy little pump
customer_reviews.text: this pump works great and seem to be well build great buy price is right when you get a product like this that is well made i would highly rate this product *****
customer_reviews.author: dick l. visser

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump!
customer_reviews.text: After having an awful Schwinn pump that I bought at a large national chain retailer, I had to search for something better and more reliable. I have owned this pump for 9 months and it still works flawlessly. It has a dual head for both presta and shrader valves without having to assemble and disassemble parts to use it for a particular valve type. With other pumps, you have to take out and reverse the components depending on the type of valve you have. I found out about this pump after two separate local bicycle stores used this model in their work/repair area. I know now why they rely on this pump. Topeak did a great job with this.
customer_reviews.author: Hamlet

customer_reviews.title: does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once but it is exactly what I wanted The hose is a bit longer than the replacement pump which is very nice. I have seen reviews about the quality of the hose, I can imagine that some day the hose may fail but it does look easy enough to replace. I like the dual valve setup. I have two bikes, each with their own type of valve, thus the need for this pump. Easily pumped the tires to 65psi.
customer_reviews.author: pnplibi

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value. I cannot believe how expensive floor pumps are. This one will do the job just as good as the more expensive ones. With this one I can easily get my road bike tires to 100+ psi. Sometimes it can be hard to get a good fit on the valve and it doesn't inflate. But retry a couple if times and it will be OK. The build quality is also really nice imo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as the old one it replaced
customer_reviews.text: I had a Joe Blow floor pump for years. I bought this one so I could give my old one to a neighbor who needed one. This one seems to pump a bit easier, not sure why. However, when used on Schrader valves the lever is too tight and is difficult to get to latch completely. The little pointer for setting a pressure slides too easily and can be moved inadvertently. Overcoming all that, it does a great job and has a built in gauge that is easy to read and seems reliable. The valve head fits both Schrader and Presta valves without any adapters. It works great on the Presta valves.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stoped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I used this pump to inflate my bicycle tires to 100 psi, pump is rated to 150 psi and stoped working after 3 months, pressurized my tires 2 to 3 times a month
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to replace an older Joe Blow pump that I passed down to my daughter. The older pump was used for many years inflating 700x25mm road tires to 105 psi and 700x32 touring tires to 80psi (both with presta valves). That pump worked great for many years and still does. This new Joe Blow works just as well but seems to inflate the tires with less effort than the older model. I don't know whether that is due to a difference in the feel of the handle or a different piston design. In my opinion, the new pump is worth five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Pacanowski

customer_reviews.title: Solid pump
customer_reviews.text: My old JoeBlow Pro has some problem in inflating Schrader valves, no matter how tight or loose I tried, the air just got stuck, it appeared the "SmartHead" was not that smart after all. Just tried the "TwinHead", the Schrader had easy and tight seal, perfect! It appeared to be well made, with metal barrel (it's made in Taiwan). One drawback I noticed was the yellow marker on pressure gauge, it's really loose, a big step backwards from JoeBlow Pro's solid marker.
customer_reviews.author: H. Zhang

customer_reviews.title: I hate the damn thing
customer_reviews.text: While it will pump air into the tire, the air pressure gauge doesn't work. The very first time I used it, the gauge displayed the right air pressure in the tires, more or less. The second time I used it and every time thereafter, the air pressure gauge displayed little to no air pressure when in fact the tires were so full of air they were near popping. I hate the damn thing.
customer_reviews.author: Larccc

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: I have fought with bike pumps all my life so I am so thrilled to have picked the right one this time. It goes on and works first time every time! No fussing trying to get the air to go in. Having the 3 different pump heads I don't have to fuss with an adapter. It's made well and being yellow, you can spot it easily in the garage if your garage is a tad full and cluttered. The clamps to hold the tubing to the pump are nice, the gauge is easy to read with the markers and it has a good base. I'm all thumbs up on this bike pump!
customer_reviews.author: my name

customer_reviews.title: The Joe Blow Sport II will PUMP YOU UP!
customer_reviews.text: After having a cheaper model Zefal that consistently tore the valves out of my tubes, I finally listened to the multitude of online reviews praising not only this pump, but the many high quality products produced by Topeak (I own one of their saddle bags, and it's superb). There's really not a whole lot to say when it comes to reviewing a floor pump: it has a dual-head for both presta and schrader valves, an easy-to-read and accurate pressure gauge, a sturdy foundation, smooth pump action. In the most basic sense, this pump does its job and does it well. A quality product that you can buy, use, and not worry about crapping out on you. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pump
customer_reviews.text: On first glance I feared that the plastic-like valve connector would not be up to snuff. After using it for awhile, I'm thinking it is more durable than it looks. The valve connector works very well on my presta stems. With my other pump, I tend to lose at least 20 pounds of pressure every time I connect it; with this one, the pressure loss is minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Mebis

customer_reviews.title: Great pump for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great pump. Requires many less pumps than my other pump to get to the same pressure. Have is easy to read and the pump base is metal. I will say that the valve lever mechanism gets tricky if your spokes are close together and you are trying to hold the bike wheel steady with one hand while engaging the valve.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality floor pump
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade from my cheap plastic floor pump after I got a road bike and needed to inflate to higher pressures. I kept coming back to the Joe Blow Sport II during my search since I didn't want to spend $60 for a higher end pump. Took a chance on this one based on the reviews and I am very happy with the purchase. It has separate nozzles for Presta and Schrader valves, which I preferred over the Smarthead version (note: I haven't tried the Smarthead for comparison). It has a solid base and I am able to easily inflate my tires with just a few strokes. The time I save means more time for riding!
customer_reviews.author: My two cents

customer_reviews.title: Great pump!!
customer_reviews.text: The best bicycle pump I have ever used! It takes a little while to get the nozzle to hook right, but once you get that down, it is great! The thing to remember is fit the nozzle to the inflation tip. Once on, the yellow lever flips towards the other side to lock it on. If you can't pump it well, stop and refit the nozzle onto the valve again. Very robust and solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pump
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good pump. I have bought pumps from auto parts places and sporting good stores which eventually failed. I have had this thing for 2 years now and it is still working great. It is a basic bicycle pump with a pressure gauge attached near the base which comes in handy. It also comes with a ball pin and an attachment for pumping up inflatables. I have since pumped everything from balloons, bikes, balls, and also my car's tires. It really is a sturdy piece of equipment and I would recommended it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Renaissance

customer_reviews.title: Built like Terry Crews
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know there was such a huge difference between a $20 Wally world pump to an actual bike pump. It's a heavy duty pump.
customer_reviews.author: ShredMyESPMan

customer_reviews.title: Good pump
customer_reviews.text: Good pump. Inflated my 130 psi tire with ease. I wished they had designed the valve differently but it works .
customer_reviews.author: DAVID BLACKMAN

customer_reviews.title: Great Inflation device
customer_reviews.text: Great Inflation device!....I say it like that because I use these pumps for many things. It's main use is for bicycle tires, and it is more than adequate to serve as my new mountain bike tire inflation device. I am hoping to get the same life out of this as I have an old Schwinn pump I used for over 25 years.....It still works but is on it's last leg. I am no pump expert, but I am really good with recognizing a quality product, and I say you can't go wrong with the value of this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Hard To Impress

customer_reviews.title: after I retire I may get a job in a bike shop just to work with fine tools like this one
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how gratifying the experience of inflating bicycle tires could be. I recently replaced my run-of-the-mill floor pump with the Topeak Joe Blow Sport II and cannot believe the improvement. I use this primarily to inflate my Presta road bike tubes, but it works very well with Schrader valves as well. The nozzle lock works very well and emits a gratifying gasp as it is released after inflating each individual tube. The gauge is legible and even has a movable arrow to indicate your commonly-used inflation pressure. Who knows, after I retire I may get a job in a bike shop just to work with fine tools like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Valley Rando

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This pump works great. I have had it for a couple of years and use it almost daily and it still works great. No complaints at all. Even the little accessories are still on it as they stay super secure in the little holder. I use mostly presta, but have used it for schrader as well for the kids bikes. The tightener (not sure what its called) at the head is a little stiff, but I just deal with that. No air leaks out when I am pumping at all so its fine by me. I couldn't recommend more.
customer_reviews.author: austinmiles

customer_reviews.title: I love how the arrow on the dial doesn't jump but ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pump for over 7 years for my tri bike. Finally the pump started to have problems but only because i started using it to blow up tires for our stroller and accidentally tried to use the wrong connector piece. This new pump feels a lot sturdier than my previous one. I love how the arrow on the dial doesn't jump but steadily shows the current pressure. The connector piece connects to the tire very well and tight. I recommend this if you need one.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin K

customer_reviews.title: Solid, very reliable pump
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this pump for three years (JoeBlow Sport II) and I have to say I am very impressed. It is incredibly sturdy and reliable. The pressure gauge is very easy to read (and it looks like the Series III is even better). The head is easy to apply and holds fast to both shrader and presta valves. No complaints - very high marks. :-)
customer_reviews.author: HappyTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line bike pump
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line bike pump. I've had one for many years, never had any issues, and have recommended Joe Blow to friends when looking for bike pumps. Years ago in a pinch I used it to pump up a vehicle tire, that's how awesome this bike pump is. Don't recommend that all btw, but no spare + no air compressor in the garage required some creativity and effort.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, Presta valve seal is 10 times better ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pump, Presta valve seal is 10 times better than Schrader. I use it much more frequently on my bikes that have Presta, but kids bikes are kind of a pain to get a good seal with Schrader, but it works eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Albeniz

customer_reviews.title: At best, the guage was off by 15
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. At best, the guage was off by 15. Then I took it to a Tri. COuld not get it to make a good connection, 2 other persons tried. Fortunately there were plenty of other pumps nearby for me to borrow. I ended up at the wrong end of their defect rate, but will be replacing with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: doggedydays

customer_reviews.title: The most sturdy pump I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I don't use them very often, and I've only ever dealt with wal-mart pumps. The last pump I had from wally world I swear I only used 5 times before the connection of the tube to the pump popped out. and the screw holding it to it stripped while trying to reattach it. Quite frustrating. But as far as this pump goes, the quality is great, worth every penny paid for it. I have used it several times, one of them to pump up an excercise ball for my wife (it comes with the attachment for such). I tell you what, using this pump was way faster than using the pump that is provided with those things.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T Blake

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PUMP
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS PUMP! Clamps on to valve easily with no air leaks. Pump is easier to use than any other I have tried especially at the higher pressures. The gauge measures accurately as opposed to the other pumps that I have had where the needle bounces up to a higher pressure when you push on the handle but then goes back down leaving you to wonder what the pressure really is. Also VERY good price for a quality pump.
customer_reviews.author: Redeemed

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pump. PROS: Pumped two completely flat tires to 60 psi in less than 25 full pumps. Gauge is easy to read & accurate to about 1-2 lbs. compared to the readout of my digital tire monitor. Shaft & base are made of metal & so far seem very durable. The air connector head can accommodate both presta & schraeder valves & even though I currently only use schraeder, I glad I have the option; also has the needle so that you can inflate your (foot/basket)-ball CON: It is a bit difficult to lock the connector head onto the valve but NOT enough to be inconvenient or make you unable to use it. Still 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Gamez III

customer_reviews.title: Great pump for cyclist looking for an affordable and reliable pump.
customer_reviews.text: I am a cyclist. I ride frequently. I had a cheaper bicycle pump from Wal-Mart. After a short time the pump got to where it would not stay on the valve when airing up the tire. I purchased this pump after some research. I am happy with this product. It has never popped off when airing up a tire. As a cyclist I air frequently and to high pressure, 110 pounds. It has performed as advertised. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Nice pump
customer_reviews.text: This pump works very well. The gauge is accurate enough that I don't bother double checking with a handheld gauge. When used on a Presta valve there is a bit of an air leak out the Schrader side of the head but it's so little as to not be a problem and has turned out to be helpful. I use the slow leak to get the "perfect" tire pressure. I go a couple PSI over what I want and let it bleed down then pop the head off the valve. The head is large but I'm able to use it on a 20x1-1/8" BMX rim without too much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: S. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Pump started leaking after 3 months of limited use
customer_reviews.text: Update: Contacted the manufacturer and they were very responsive, sending repair parts. Two more stars for that. Will use the pump for the next several months and update my rating (up? down?) accordingly. Original review: Bought the pump in January. Used less than two dozen times. Pump leaks at junction where the hose connects to the pump. Too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: rrbegin

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the warrantee
customer_reviews.text: Initially this was a great pump. Reasonably priced and accurate (I have a road bike). But the head started leaking after 6 months, and the needle would slowly fall. Given the warranty, I phoned the firm to get a replacement head. They sent me a replacement gauge. I phoned again, asking for a replacement head. They said it's on back order. Two months later, I still haven't received it.
customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: This has to be the best Manual pump there is
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best Manual pump there is. There is no pressure level that you cannot reach, and connecting and disconnecting is simple as pie. No leakage. If you need a pump just get it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Third time's the charm
customer_reviews.text: These are so good I had to buy a second one, when the first one stopped working! Unfortunately, my second one has hissed since I got it and now that I sold my road bike to get a mountain bike for some reason the gauge doesn't go past like 15 psi even though it also uses presta valves. Now that I think about it, I don't think it ever worked well on schrader valves however, darn thing always over estimated then slowly lowered dozens of psi regardless how much air was in the tires
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT IS A PLEASURE TO USE
customer_reviews.text: If you really want to experience the full impact of why this pump is the BEST, first buy and use the top-of-the-line Walmart air pump for $26. There is no comparison in ease of use, accuracy of the gauge, and quality of material. Highly recommend. Spend the extra $20-you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda RN

customer_reviews.title: Works great, so much better than my fancier one which ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, so much better than my fancier one which is a pain to work with. I love the double sided valve, since I use both Presta and Schrader. The little arrow for marking your desired pressure is so loose it easily falls out of place, so it's useless, which is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Barwell

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Pump
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I got sick of my Park Tool one that did not work right. So far, I have been very pleased with thus pump. The valve head locks on very nicely, and I never have a problem with air coming out of the opposite hole, such as trying to use the presta hole and air coming out odlf the schrader hole. That is a problem that I often had with my Park Tool pump. This pump seems to inflate very quickly and I like how solid it is built.
customer_reviews.author: Edan C

customer_reviews.title: great pump, guage seems to be off so far.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality pump. The gauge appears to be off though, which is kind of a pain. For me its not absolutely critical since I know where I like my tires to feel, But if it has a guage you expect it to work. It may be getting better, I'm not sure. The first time I used it, it was way off. The second time, it was off maybe less. I haven't needed to pump my tires that much since I got it, but I've liked the build quality otherwise. hoping this lasts for more than a few years.
customer_reviews.author: michaelbuddy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid pump
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid pump. Should outlast all my other cheap walmart pumps. Its not my dream pump but at the price, its hard to beat. A friend I ride with has a pump made by Specialized and its freak'n awesome but I just can't see spending $100 on a pump for sake of saving a few pumps of handle. For under $40, you can't go wrong with this pump. BTW, the gauge is pretty accurate! I double checked with the gauge I use on my truck tires and it was spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo B.

customer_reviews.title: Packed full of features at a modest price point
customer_reviews.text: This was my first venture into the world of premium bike pumps and so far I have been beyond impressed by the quality that this pump is made. The dual action head is great for my room mate who doesn't use presta valves and the automatic pressure relief valve is a nice touch. I thought I would be worrying about that handle but it has stood up great. The base is metal which ensures years of use. Overall can't find a better value in a pump under 60$
customer_reviews.author: Pinnaclepixelphoto

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great pump, although it came with no instruction on how it works, I managed to find a youtube video that someone made about how to use it. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Good value on quality bicycle pump
customer_reviews.text: Quality pump at a reasonable price. Easy to inflate either type of valve stem. The air gauge seems accurate (at least accurate enough for a recreational rider). Came with inflators for pool toys or balls, which is handy to have. The wide base is stable and the smooth action makes it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: J Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: I replaced its predecessor which was 30 years old - this looks to be a good replacement 👍
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Patenaude

customer_reviews.title: Quality pump with nice features
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump. Its an awesome addition to my bike gear. I love the dual valve support for Princeton and Schrader and the ball and inflatable items adapters. The footplate is nice an wide for good foot placement and it pumps air quickly and efficiently. Worth it. Buy one! If anyone out there know how the heck to use the ball adapter I'd sure appreciate it. I can not get that to work for the life of me... Which valve do I use and how do I get it fitted and snug right?
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, nice price.....
customer_reviews.text: This pump does a nice job. So far I've used to to pump up bike tires with Schrader valves, and an exercise/yoga ball with the cone shaped attachment. Both worked great. It locks on to the tire valve easily and securely, and you don't lose air when you release it. I especially like the "marker ring" around the edge of the pressure gauge. You twist it to point to the desired pressure of the item you're pumping up, and then it's very easy to tell at a glance when you've reached the desired presure.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Stutzke

customer_reviews.title: Pumping is a breeze, which is good...
customer_reviews.text: Had this pump for a while, so far so good. Feels sturdy, pumps up my road tires super easy. Only qualms are when you release the head from the valve it feels like a lot of air sneaks out the schrader side. Granted most pumps do this and considering how easy this thing is to use it's no feat to just pump the tire up a few extra pounds to negate this or hold your thumb over the other hole while releasing. Now that I've had my Andy Rooney moment I would highly recommend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba

customer_reviews.title: BEST pump I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had a LOT of pumps over the years. Really, REALLY like this one. Was tired of monkeying around with getting a seal on my Presta valves---but not any more. The dual Presta/Shrader head is fantastic. Just-long-enough hose. Minimal air loss upon disengagement of pump head. Integrated nozzles for beach balls/footballs/etc. Solid stand. Best pump I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pump, Well Made, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: An excellent easy to use bike pump. Easily inflates tires to at least 120PSI will little effort. Comes complete with some adapters as well. I liked it so well I bought two. Quality is excellent for the price point, you could spend a lot more and not get a better pump
customer_reviews.author: AudiR8Guy

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Pump
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted for a dozen or so uses. Developed a leak in the system that prevented it from holding pressure. Only works if you pump really fast (putting air in faster than the leak). The leak also prevents the gauge from working so you have no idea the amount of pressure in the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Zonies

customer_reviews.title: Rusty foot.
customer_reviews.text: It functions, but I cannot say any better than other bicycle pumps. Rusty foot - should not happen. I never leave my tools outside (in the rain).
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good pump for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bike pump for the price. It is much easier to pump at higher pressures than other pumps I have had. The gauge is easy to read and the dual head makes it really easy to switch between presta and Schader valves. The only negative thing I can say about it is that the metal base doesn't sit flush on the floor, it wobbles back and forth a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great Dual-Valve Pump
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Supports Presta and Schrader valve types, quick switch between them, and handy hose rings to keep everything tidy. The pressure gauge is a nice bonus. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RumuR

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the excellent reviews
customer_reviews.text: This pump gets great reviews on and off Amazon and it lived up to the reputation. It is easy to use, seems well made, has a great dial, good handle, and nice wide base which makes it very stable and easy to stand on, even with bike shoes. I've not tried the schrader valve but the presta one works very well. The hose is long enough without getting in the way and easily clips into the shaft.
customer_reviews.author: G. Watson

product_meta.title: Topeak Sport II Floor Pump
product_meta.description:
JOEBLOW SPORT II FLOOR PUMP
The Topeak Joe Blow Sport II Floor Pump gets your tires ready to go, wherever the road may take you.

TWINHEAD TECHNOLOGY
With Presta valve internals on one side and Schrader valve internals on the other, this easy-to-use dual pump head design makes tire inflation chores a snap. No adapters or swapping out pump head parts, simply choose the side you want, press onto the valve stem, flip the locking lever, and start pumping. The original TwinHead dual sided design makes adapters obsolete.

AT A GLANCE
 * Head: TwinHead
 * Barrel: Painted steel
 * Gauge: Base mount analog
 * Hose: X-long 360 pivot
 * Handle: Oversize padded
 * Capacity: 160 psi / 11 bar
 * Base: Hardened steel
 * Ball / bladder heads
 * Hose dock
 * Size (L x W x H): 13.7 x 25 x 67.5 cm / 5.4” x 9.8” x 26.6”
 * Weight: 1.4 kgs / 3.09 lbs

Easy to read chronograph inspired pressure gauge with PSI and Bar Indexview larger Works with Presta, Schrader or Dunlop valvesview larger Double-Sided TwinHead works with Presta and Schrader valvesview larger Rotating connection keeps hose tangle freeview larger Oversized padded handle adds comfortview larger Hose dock helps protect hose & head while not in useview larger Hardened steel base is wide for added stabilityview larger Ball and bladder needles are included and fit neatly in their own holderview larger
feature_bullets: Used by both professional and amateur riders alike
Made using high quality materials and components
Tested to ensure quality and durability
Made in Taiwan. Size : 67.5 x 25 x 13.7 cm / 26.6” x 9.8” x 5.4”

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
